page.title: 11HOVE'S AGEING POPULATION.
page.content: Of Hove's 84,000 population in l984 some 34% were of retirement age.The over 75's alone represented 12.6% and 26% of the households were single pensioners living on their own. This can partly be attributed to the embracing and invigorating sea air, as well as the fine clean reputation Hove has s a resort.As a result of its high average age of residents and the necessary wealth needed to survive in such an affluent resort, Hove was described by the Sunday Times in February 1984 as being the 'safest Conservative seat in the country, comprised of middle-class, elderly retired population.'
